channel.title: HDD Trouble
channel.description:
Hi, there.
Last week, I was using my laptop downstairs, closed the lid, ran upstairs, opened it, click the mouse, the blue stop error screen flashed real quick, and the laptop was off. Upon rebooting, I found the "No Operating System Found" error. I then proceeded to pop in my Windows XP disc. After everything loaded, the setup told me it could find no hard drive on my system.
So, yesterday, I got an external case for my drive, plugged the puppy in, got some stuff off it onto my PC, reformatted it, ran the error-checking tool, which returned with no errors, put it back into the laptop and BIOS detected no hard drive.
I then tried to use the external case to install Windows , which was successful, up until the part where setup rebooted, which gave me another blue stop error screen saying "Check your computer for viruses, run CHKDSK /F to search for bad sectors". Did that, retried, same results.
So, I am guessing it is a either:
a.) Bad seating in laptop hard drive bay. b.) Bad hard drive. c.) God's wrath. d.) Can't think of anything else.
I took it to the local computer repair shop, who said the OS just crashed and charged me $35 :rolleyes:
I've tried various drive diagnostics tools, which haven't seemed to help.
Any ideas, please?
